text:
substance: n-Hexane | type_of_trv: Oral TDI
(provisional) | trv_value: 1.0E-01
mg/kg -day
BW | study_details: Study Type: subchronic
Species: rats
Mode of Administration: gavage
Exposure Regime: 0, 66, 132, or
264 mg/day, 7 days/week
Duration: 4 weeks
Uncertainty Factors: 90 (10 for
intraspecies variability, 3 for interspecies
variability, and 3 for deficiencies in
the database) | threshold_non_threshold_endpoint: POD = 8 mg/kg -day
BW | trv_derivation_method: TDI = POD/UF | critical_effect_s: Neurotoxicity
(motor nerve
conduction
velocity, mixed
nerve conduction
velocity) | carcinogenicity_classification: CEPA:
not assessed
IARC:
not classified
US EPA IRIS:
inadequate
information to
assess carcinogenic
potential (US EPA,
2005b) | source: CCME, 2011
(based on EEI,
2008 [derived
from Ono et al.,
1979, 1981])

substance: n-Hexane | type_of_trv: Inhalation TC
(provisional) | trv_value: 7.0E-01
mg/m3 | study_details: Study Type: subchronic
Species: Wistar male rats
Mode of Administration: inhalation
(whole body exposure chambers)
Exposure Regime: 0, 500, 1200, or
3000 ppm nhexane vapour (0, 1762,
4230, or 10 574 mg/m3), 12 hours/day,
7 days/week
Duration: 16 weeks
Uncertainty Factors: 300 (10 for
intraspecies variability, 3 for interspecies
variability, 3 for use of a subchronic study,
and 3 for database deficiencies) | threshold_non_threshold_endpoint: BMCL = 122 ppm
(430 mg/m3) | trv_derivation_method: BMCL adjusted for
continuous exposure
BMCL = 215 mg/m3
HEC
TC = BMCL /UF
HEC | critical_effect_s: Neurotoxicity
(peripheral
neuropathy –
decreased motor
nerve conduction
velocity) | source: US EPA, 2005b
(based on
Huang et al.,
1989)

substance: Lead1 | type_of_trv: Risk-specifci dose
(provisional) | trv_value: 5.0E-04
mg/kg -day
BW | study_details: Study Type: epidemiological
(meta-analysis)
Species: humans
Mode of Exposure: N/A
Exposure Concentrations: N/A
Duration: from birth or infancy until 5
to 10 years of age
Uncertainty Factors: none | threshold_non_threshold_endpoint: BMDL =
01
0.5 µg/kg -day
BW | trv_derivation_method: 95th lower confidence limit
of the BMD associated with
a 1 IQ point decrement
(intake rate associated with
a drop of 1 IQ point in a
population of children)
Risk-specific dose = BMDL
01
(no adjustment) | critical_effect_s: Neuro-
developmental
toxicity
(cognitive function) | carcinogenicity_classification: CEPA:
not classified
IARC: Group 2A
probably
carcinogenic
to humans
(IARC, 2006)
US EPA IRIS:
Group B2
probable human
carcinogen
(US EPA, 1988b) | source: EFSA, 2013
(based on
Lanphear et al.,
2005)
